Earthquakes are more frequent in autumn and spring, as is lightning. Consequently the Gallie provinces and Egypt suffer very little from them, as in the latter the summer is the cause that prevents them and in the former the winter. Similarly they are more frequent by night than in the daytime. The severest earthquakes occur in the morning and the evem‘ng, but they are frequent near dawn and in the daytime about noon.
